txt.en: Dervorin is in the Crossing-hall.\n\nTalk to Dervorin.
The book contains records of many transactions, none of it to do with land or property
Dervorin would like your help examining old records.\n\nExamine records in the Crossing-hall.

After poring over line after line of near-indecipherable script, you discover that Dravron's claim is valid.\n\nIt seems that Dervorin must find a new course of action if he wishes to dislodge Dravron from the lumber camp.
Dervorin would like your help examining old records.\n\nExamine records in the Crossing-hall.
This book appears to be a personal journal of one of Dervorin's ancestors. Best leave it unread
Dervorin is sure that Dravron's deed is a forgery, but needs to verify his suspicion by cross-referencing with the record books.

Dervorin's face goes slack when you deliver the news.

'Are you sure? Are you absolutely, completely, and irreproachably sure?!

'Of course, I do not mean to second guess your abilities, but could you check again? No, wait, don
